title: Get started
text: First, let’s consider temperature measurements taken June.  many times three days row, temperatures 83F? answer question, first look plot.  two sequences days temperatures 83F. One two days, one 5 days. last sequence meets condition “three days ”. Now, let’s use nseq package compute us. many times two days sequence temperatures 75F?
code: june_data <- subset(airquality, Month == 6) library(ggplot2)  ggplot(june_data, aes(x = Day, y = Temp)) +   geom_line() +   geom_point() +   theme_bw() ggplot(june_data, aes(x = Day, y = Temp)) +   geom_line() +   geom_point() +   geom_hline(yintercept = 83, color = "red") +   theme_bw() trle_cond(june_data$Temp, a_op = "gte", a = 3, b_op = "gte", b = 83) #> [1] 1 ggplot(june_data, aes(x = Day, y = Temp)) +   geom_line() +   geom_point() +   geom_hline(yintercept = 75, color = "red") +   theme_bw() trle_cond(june_data$Temp, a_op = "gte", a = 2, b_op = "lte", b = 75) #> [1] 2

title: Get started
text: can use nseq functions inside ?dplyr::summarise compute counts groups. month, many sequences three days presented temperatures month’s average.
code: library(dplyr)  airquality |>   summarise(     avg = mean(Temp, na.rm = TRUE),     count_3 = trle_cond(Temp, a_op = "gte", a = 3, b_op = "gte", b = avg),      .by = Month   ) #>   Month      avg count_3 #> 1     5 65.54839       3 #> 2     6 79.10000       1 #> 3     7 83.90323       3 #> 4     8 83.96774       2 #> 5     9 76.90000       1 month_avg <- airquality |>   summarise(     avg = mean(Temp, na.rm = TRUE),     .by = Month   )  airquality |>   left_join(month_avg, by = "Month") |>   mutate(date = as.Date(paste0(1973,"-",Month,"-",Day))) |>    ggplot(aes(x = date)) +     geom_line(aes(y = Temp)) +     geom_step(aes(y = avg), color = "red") +     geom_point(aes(y = Temp)) +     theme_bw()

what: Shifts vector values to right or left — shift
title: Shifts vector values to right or left — shift
text: Shifts vector values right left

title: Shifts vector values to right or left — shift
code: shift(x, n, invert = FALSE, default = NA)

title: Shifts vector values to right or left — shift
text: x Vector shift values n Number places shifted. Positive numbers shift right default. Negative numbers shift left default. direction can inverted invert parameter. invert Whether default shift directions inverted. default value inserted default.

title: Shifts vector values to right or left — shift
text: vector.

title: Shifts vector values to right or left — shift

what: Run Length Encoding and return result as a data frame — trle
title: Run Length Encoding and return result as a data frame — trle
text: Given tibble object variable y, function count number occurrence element y sequence appear, return count tibble object.

title: Run Length Encoding and return result as a data frame — trle
Run Length Encoding and return result as a data frame — trle
text: x vector.

title: Run Length Encoding and return result as a data frame — trle
text: data.frame object.

title: Run Length Encoding and return result as a data frame — trle

what: Count the number of events in a sequence — trle_cond
title: Count the number of events in a sequence — trle_cond
text: function count occurrence sequential events meets conditions.

title: Count the number of events in a sequence — trle_cond
code: trle_cond(x, a_op = "gte", a, b_op = "gte", b, isolated = FALSE)

title: Count the number of events in a sequence — trle_cond
text: x numeric vector. a_op, b_op character. Operator, gte = greater equal, lte = less equal, gt = greater , lt = less , e = equal. integer. Length period threshold. b integer. Value threshold. isolated logical. Consider isolated events, .e. surrounded zeros. case, a_op considered.

title: Count the number of events in a sequence — trle_cond
text: numeric value.

title: Count the number of events in a sequence — trle_cond
text: Example: vector, many sequences least 3 consecutive observations (a_op = "gte", = 3) values equal greater 5 (b_op = "gte", b = 5)?

title: Count the number of events in a sequence — trle_cond
code: # How many sequences have at least 3 consecutive observations with value equal or greater than 5? trle_cond(x = c(8,15,20,0,0,0,0,5,9,12), a_op = "gte", a = 3, b_op = "gte", b = 5) #> [1] 2

what: Statistics of events in a sequence — trle_cond_stat
title: Statistics of events in a sequence — trle_cond_stat
text: function compute statistics sequential events meets conditions.

title: Statistics of events in a sequence — trle_cond_stat
Statistics of events in a sequence — trle_cond_stat
text: x numeric vector. b integer. Value threshold. b_op character. Operator, gte = greater equal, lte = less equal, gt = greater , lt = less , e = equal. stat character. statistic calculated. One : max, min, mean, median, sd, var.

title: Statistics of events in a sequence — trle_cond_stat
text: numeric value

title: Statistics of events in a sequence — trle_cond_stat
text: Example: vector, maximum size sequences values equal greater 5?

title: Statistics of events in a sequence — trle_cond_stat
code: # What is the maximum size of sequences with values equal or greater than 5? trle_cond_stat(c(4,6,6,4,7,8,9), b = 5, b_op = "gte", stat = "max") #> [1] 3
